did.abstract: Advocacy organization established to protect the rights of developmentally challenged individuals; records include meeting minutes, reports and publications, affiliate files, and visual materials.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: This record group was donated by The Arc Michigan (donor no. 8857) beginning in 1999; additions were received in 2009.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Arc Michigan records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Arc Michigan is an association dedicated to positively affect the lives of people with disabilities and their families through advocacy, education and monitoring. It is directly affiliated with The Arc, a national association, which was founded in the 1950's by a group of parents whose children needed special assistance.
In 1953 the name was changed to "Michigan Association for Retarded Children" and in 1982, after numerous name changes their current name was selected.

During the early days, The Arc concentrated on public education and advocacy and individual and family support. By 1989, there were a total of 62 local units and about 6300 member families advocating for the rights of the disabled and mentally retarded.

The Arc Michigan conducts yearly strategic planning to update its goals and to stay current with the evolving needs of people with disabilities. This plan is what determines future activities, budgets, programs, staff and volunteer recruitment to provide services such as civil rights, health care and early intervention and education.

scopecontent.p: The records of The ARC date primarily from the 1980's until 2007, with some documents from the 1950's through the 1970's. They include meeting minutes, surveys, grant proposals, project documentation, correspondence and publications. These records document the various projects of this organization, including advocacy and individual care. The records are arranged into eight series as follows: Board and Governance, Committees, Conferences and Collaborations, Reports and Programs, Publications, Affiliates, and Visual Materials.

The Board and Governance series includes history, mission, manuals, by laws, policies, and strategic plans, meeting minutes, grants, member biographies, position statements, resolutions and some correspondence.
The Committees series consists of minutes of the various committees and their activities: Membership, Education, Executive, Nominating, Finance and Search.

did.unittitle: Biographies of Executive Committee and Directors at Large

scopecontent.p: The series on Conferences and Collaborations includes information concerning annual conferences as well as joint conferences and collaborative efforts with other organizations such as the Autism Society and Wayne State University. This series also includes minutes, brochures photographs and hand outs, evaluations and participant information.
The Reports series provides information and evaluation of the various programs conducted by The ARC.
The Programs series includes information on the various programs such as Early On, Dignified Lifestyles, Parent Leadership Program and activities such as various family gatherings.

did.unittitle: Early On Infant Toddler intervention system grant 2000
Revised Early On individualized family service plan 1999-2005
Statistics and Analysis of Family Gatherings
Developmental Disabilities Council / Michigan Department of Mental Health (correspondence)

scopecontent.p: The Publication series includes brochures, newsletters, fliers and other hand outs published and used by The Arc and its affiliates.

The Affiliates series includes information on the various local affiliates, by county, in Michigan, their activities and including fee issues and additional correspondence. This series is arranged in alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: Affiliations with United Way and Wayne State University

scopecontent.p: The Visual Materials series consists of photographs of some staff of The Arc and of various events and conferences. Also in this series are a number of video tapes some produced by The Arc and others acquired for use by staff. A number of motion pictures are also found in this series.
